docs.lead_paragraph: The Republican presidential hopefuls are resurrecting long-refuted ideas as if they actually worked.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column derides Republican presidential hopefuls for relying on 'zombie' policies--theories that have long been proven unfounded but continue to slog along nevertheless; says candidates are only promoting such ludicrous ideas, like failure of Obamacare and voodoo economics, to satisfy far right in their party, given that Democrats in their states pose no challenge.
docs.snippet: The Republican presidential hopefuls are resurrecting long-refuted ideas as if they actually worked.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama fought back on Thursday against the biggest domestic obstacle to the Pacific trade pact he wants to conclude before he leaves office: the trade skeptics in his own Democratic party.

docs.lead_paragraph: Cardinal Francis George was remembered Thursday as a man of deep faith, intellect and compassion as Catholics said their final goodbyes to the man who led the nation's third-largest archdiocese and was known as a vigorous defender of Roman Catholic orthodoxy.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. part-time employment is fast-approaching levels common since the 1970s in a sign that a key part of labor market slack may be almost gone, giving the Fed one less reason to delay hiking interest rates frozen near zero for more than six years.

headline.main: Part-Time 'Slack' May Be Nearing Its End as Fed Debates Hike
headline.print_headline: Part-Time 'Slack' May Be Nearing Its End as Fed Debates Hike

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama's health care law has had a surprising side effect: In some states, it appears to be enticing more Americans to apply for food stamps, even as the economy improves.

headline.print_headline: Health Law Brings Growth in Food Stamps in Some States

docs.lead_paragraph: The IRS' overloaded phone system hung up on more than 8 million taxpayers this filing season as the agency cut millions of dollars from taxpayer services to help pay to enforce President Barack Obama's health law.

headline.main: Hello? 8M Phone Calls Unanswered as IRS Cut Taxpayer Service
headline.print_headline: Hello? 8M Phone Calls Unanswered as IRS Cut Taxpayer Service
